content:
##Quadrilaterals

A quadrilateral is a polygon with four sides.

### Study some  examples

Here are some examples of quadrilaterals:

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ image 3]]

###Try it yourself

[[☃ graded-group 1]]

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
The following shapes are quadrilaterals because they are polygons with four sides. Remember: polygons must be closed figures.

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ image 3]]

options.alt: A rectangular shape with 4 sides.
A square shape with 4 sides.
A parallelogram shape with 4 sides.

options.content:
**Which of the following shapes are quadrilaterals?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A shape with 4 sides. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up and right.

A shape with 4 sides. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.

A shape with 4 sides. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.

content:
## Special types of quadrilaterals

Some quadrilaterals go by special names like *rectangle*, *rhombus*, and *square*. Let's learn about them!

## Rectangles

What makes a shape a rectangle?

* There are four right angles.
* There are four sides because it's a quadrilateral.

### Study some examples

Here are some examples of rectangles:

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ image 3]]

### Try it yourself

[[☃ graded-group 1]]

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
The following shapes are rectangles because they are quadrilaterals with four right angles. Remember: quadrilaterals must have four sides.*

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A shape with 4 sides and 4 right angles. The top and bottom sides are shorter than left and right sides.
A shape with 4 sides and 4 right angles. The top and bottom sides are longer than left and right sides

options.content:
**Which of the following shapes are rectangles?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A shape with 4 sides and 4 right angles. The top and bottom sides are shorter than left and right sides.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/069f98272a0ffd87d781d7ffc9657c497c16e235)
![A shape with 4 sides and 4 right angles. The top and bottom sides are longer than left and right sides.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/932e971eb41ec27af9aff9cf07b176b87e78a59e)
![A shape with 4 sides and no right angles.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/1ef18311bda60c1e5c0183df47f4977727d5f048)

options.alt: A smaller horizontal rectangle.
A vertical rectangle.
A larger horizontal rectangle.

content:
### Challenge problem

Let's consider one more shape:

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ graded-group 1]]

[[☃ graded-group 2]]

[[☃ graded-group 3]]

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
That's right!  

A rectangle is a quadrilateral with four right angles.

Squares are quadrilaterals. Squares have four right angles.

So, squares are rectangles!
options.showPrompt: Whoa, wait! Isn't that a square?

options.content:
**Does the shape have four right angles?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

**So, is the shape a rectangle?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.

content:
## Rhombuses

What makes a shape a rhombus?

* All sides are the same length.
* There are four sides because it is a quadrilateral.

### Study some examples

Here are some examples of rhombuses:

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ image 3]]

[[☃ explanation 3]]

### Try it yourself

[[☃ graded-group 3]]

[[☃ explanation 4]]

options.explanation:
Yes, it is!  

A rhombus is a quadrilateral with all sides of equal length.

Squares are quadrilaterals. Squares have all sides of equal length.

So, squares are rhombuses!
options.showPrompt: Isn't that last one a square?

options.explanation:
The following shapes are rhombuses because they are quadrilaterals with all sides of equal length:  

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ image 3]]

options.alt: A shape with 4 equal sides and no right angles

A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.

A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.

options.content:
**Which of the following shapes are rhombuses?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A shape with 4 equal sides and no right angles.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d23859995c1e45efa945f510d9c906fb1da6856a)

![A shape with 4 sides and 4 right angles. The left and right sides are longer than the top and bottom sides.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/648923014b343d718ed90ae86bbdb5a7112d31b8)

![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/36e3e3ad44c8416f2aaf2c8389aaf014973277ee)

![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5b5115f03c8fe40ca8a2331eb01c921ccd369058)

![A shape with 4 sides and no right angles. The left and right sides are shorter than the top and bottom sides.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4b8fb5832ecbbe01ad450b9805143f4d66be0600)

options.alt: A shape with 4 equal sides and no right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down and right, straight line to the left, straight line up and left.

A shape with 4 equal sides and no right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.

A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.

content:
##Squares

What makes a shape a square?

* All sides are of equal length.
* There are four right angles.
* There are four sides because it's a quadrilateral.

### Study some examples

Here are some examples of squares:

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ image 3]]

### Try it yourself

[[☃ graded-group 1]]

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
The following shapes are squares because they are quadrilaterals with four right angles *and* all sides of equal length:  

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.  The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.

A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.

options.content:
**Which of the following shapes are squares?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A shape with 6 sides and no right angles. All sides are equal.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4f235405be4c992eb3de926d46bb56e32915b859)

![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.  The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/27d7693f5ac5ea41df1c773cd3f396a3eb26bc81)

![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/1673ee90b42709efbe1d8044de04f94da931392a)

![A shape with 4 sides and 4 right angles. The left and right sides are shorter than the top and bottom sides.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/59f66d5ba78ed5a1a2ec79128b2783e0a76e4fde)
![A shape with 4 sides and no right angles.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/8f506724f58f06dfff17a456605a7961e9867c24)

options.alt: A larger shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.

A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.

A smaller shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line to the right, straight line down, straight line to the left, straight line up.

options.explanation:
A $\blueD{\text{rectangle}}$ is a quadrilateral with $\blueD{\text{four right angles}}$.

A $\greenD{\text{rhombus}}$ is a quadrilateral with $\greenD{\text{all sides of equal length}}$.

A square is a quadrilateral with $\blueD{\text{four right angles}}$ and $\greenD{\text{all sides of equal length}}$.

So, a square is a $\blueD{\text{rectangle}}$ *and* a $\greenD{\text{rhombus}}$.  

The solution is to draw a square.

options.content:
**Drag the points to create a shape that is both a rectangle and a rhombus.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

options.explanation:
A quadrilateral is a four-sided polygon. Is this shape a four-sided polygon? Yes!

A rectangle is a quadrilateral with four right angles. Does this shape have four right angles? Yes!

A rhombus is a quadrilateral with all sides of equal length. Does this shape have all sides of equal length? Yes!

A square is a four-sided polygon with four right angles and all sides of equal length. Is this shape a square?  Yes!

So, the shape is a quadrilateral, rectangle, rhombus, and square!

options.content:
**Which of the following describe this shape?**

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. The direction of each side is as follows, beginning at the top and continuing in a clockwise pattern: straight line down and right, straight line down and left, straight line up and left, straight line up and right.
